## DOC/COMMANDS FOLDER

This folder contains documentation about the commands that are available in the "Nom" language.

An index of each command and a link to its documentation is here href="/doc/commands/doc.dir.index.html">/doc/commands/doc.dir.index.html

The pep interpreter will provide a list of commands with the *-c* switch and a short summary with the *-C* switch. Some of the commands below are not in the format that they would actually be used in a script. For example *untiltape* is actually written as:

 until;  # read input stream until workspace ends with current cell

display all valid Nom commands with "pep -c" 

 pep -c

nom://add adds a given text to the workspace buffer >> nom://clip removes one character from the end of the workspace >> nom://clop removes one character from the beginning of the workspace >> nom://clear clears the workspace >> nom://replace replace one string with another in the workspace >> nom://upper converts all characters to uppercase in the workspace >> nom://lower converts all characters to lowercase in the workspace >> nom:cap First char in workspace uppercase, the rest lowercase >> nom:print prints the workspace to stdout >> nom:pop pops from the stack to the start of the workspace >> nom:push push (*) delimited token from start of the workspace to the stack >> nom:unstack pops entire stack onto the beginning of the workspace >> nom:stack pushes entire workspace onto the stack >> nom:put puts the workspace into the current tape cell >> nom:get Appends current tape cell to the workspace >> nom:swap swaps the current tape cell and the workspace >> nom:++ increments the current tape cell by one >> nom:-- decrements the current tape cell by one >> nom:mark marks the current tape cell with the given text >> nom:go sets the tape cell pointer to the marked cell >> nom:read read a character from the input stream >> nom:until reads the input stream until the workspace ends with given text >> nom:untiltape reads the input stream until the workspace ends with tape-cell text >> nom:while reads io while peek is something >> nom:whilenot reads io while peek is not something >> nom:count appends the value of the accumulator to the workspace >> nom:a+ increments the machine accumulator by one >> nom:a- decrements the accumulator by one >> nom:zero sets the numerical accumulator to zero >> nom:chars Appends number of characters read to end of workspace buffer >> nom:lines Appends number of lines read to end of workspace buffer >> nom:nochars Sets the character counter to zero >> nom:nolines Sets the line counter to zero >> nom:escape prefixes the given character with the escape character >> nom:unescape converts chars to unescaped equivalent >> nom:echar changes the default escape character >> nom:delim changes the stack token delimited to the given character >> nom:state prints the current state of the machine. >> nom:quit immediately exits the script >> nom:write writes the workspace to default file 'sav.pp' >> nom:writefile writes the workspace to a file >> nom:appendfile appends the workspace to a given file >>
